column1: #Text=BBC : Ethiopian famine aid ' siphoned off ' to buy weapons according to rebels , report

#Text=According to a BBC report , funds raised for famine relief aid in Ethiopia , such as those raised by the Live Aid benefit concert pictured here , were " siphoned off " by rebels to buy weapons .

#Text=An investigation by the BBC has revealed that millions of dollars in famine relief aid money , including the money raised from the charity supergroup Band Aid and the Live Aid concert held by Bob Geldof , was " siphoned off " by Ethiopian rebels to buy weapons .
#Text=One rebel said that at least US$ 95 million ( £63 million ) from — Western governments and private charities — was diverted into rebel coffers .

#Text=This was also noted in a declassified Central Intelligence Agency assessment of the famine situation titled Ethiopia : Political and Security Impact of the Drought , in which the report states , "

#Text=Nick Guttmann , who is director of emergency relief operations for the group , says the  story has to be put into context " .

column1: #Text=" We were working in a major conflict , there was a massive famine and people on all sides were suffering , " Guttmann said , adding , " Both the rebels and the government were using innocent civilians to further their own political ends .
